location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'PROPOSED COAL DEPOT KUWEIT BLOCK PLAN Scale 1 inch = 40 feet'

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: printed on tracing paper. Dimensions: 600 mm x 760 mm.

mods.abstract: This plan is accompanied by a short covering note (IOR/R/15/5/58, folio 76) describing it as ‘Plan of Coaling Pier’. The plan shows the position, outline and measurements of seven coal godowns and the watchmen’s quarters, which are all drawn in red ink. The plan also shows the position, outline and measurements of the nearby Shaikh’s coal shed, which is drawn in black ink. There are also six water lines, drawn in blue ink, one of which is described as the High Water Springs Line. A smaller map section on which is drawn high and low water lines bears the statement ‘Copied from plan of Shweikh drawn by Officers of H.M.S. Lapwing 1909.'
